intro: Salomonia cobrensis, commonly known as the Cobresi salomonia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Salomonia cobrensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
